comments:
Christian, this bug's for you.

Unrelated... I notice the default assignee here is "Dummy mdt-uml2 ocl inbox <mdt-ocl-inbox@eclipse.org>" Why is there a "uml2" in there? Kenn, is that something you can fix? (Or, give me access in the Committer Tools site and I'll do it for you.)
That e-mail ID is from the days of the outlaw "sub"-components.

There doesn't appear to be a way to change the description from committer tools... Christian, would you mind asking Denis/Matt to change it (probably need to open a bug?); we should also make sure the decriptions of the inbox identifiers for all of the "formerly outlawed" components are correct...

I suspect that the Client stereotype in your profile does not have a
getAllOperations() operation defined.  The Classifier *metaclass* in the UML
metamodel has this operation.  So the following change to your code snippet
makes it work:

helper.setInstanceContext((Classifier) classifiers.get(0)); // the stereotype
Client

This indicates to the OCLHelper that the context object is an *instance* of the
OCL context classifier, not the context classifier, itself (this is confusing
when you're dealing with UML models, because UML is self-describing).

traces.message: ERROR in (operationCallExpCS): (Cannot find operation (getAllAttributes()) for the type (Client))
